results.title: Australian tourism [advertisement]
results.brief_description: Developed by Mojo MDA for the Australian Tourism Commission this advertisement was part of the ‘come and say g’day’ campaign and features Paul Hogan in a range of locations across Australia. It also uses a range of Australian slang expressions including a play on the famous expression ‘put another prawn on the barbie’.

results.title: Round the twist: lighthouse blues
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Gribble and his partner evict the Twists from the lighthouse in order to build an amusement park. But with the help of some friendly ghosts, the Twists win the battle to save their home.

results.title: Round the twist: know all
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twists find a trunk full of old circus costumes and dress the scarecrow in a clown’s outfit. But the scarecrow comes to life and chases Linda. Fortunately Dad, dressed as a fortune teller, sees and knows all.

results.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.brief_description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.

results.title: Meeting of minds: the mentor program
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program explores four mentor-student relationships. Each relationship is unique and serves to demonstrate the versatility of the mentor concept. The students are shown in their home and school environment. Administrative processes involved in the mentor program are also illustrated.

results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Celebrations
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A documentary film presenting six different and authentic celebrations involving people in the multicultural community of Melbourne. Depicts an Aboriginal dance showing body decoration preparation, an Indonesian Muslim wedding celebration, an Australian child’s birthday party, a Greek nameday party, Christmas festivities and a Northern Italian Christmas celebration. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Getting the message
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Dramatization of the difficulties faced by an illiterate adult in employment and social situations. Suggests that with concern and adequate teaching methods this problem can be overcome. The film highlights the plight of the hundreds of illiterate Australian adults.

results.title: A Day at the Ascot Vale School No 2608
results.brief_description: Portrays the outdoor life at a school in the 1920s. Shows school dress, assembly, physical training, organised dancing and games. Junior Red Cross activities, Mothers Club and School Committee.

results.title: The Punter
results.brief_description: A short film about Jack Burnett and his involvment in the horse racing industry in the 1970s. (Jack is the father-in-law of the filmmaker) Identifiable with many students. Could be used for discussion on the idea of bought leisure and deals with gambling relating to horse racing.
